reviews.text: Ok, maybe I shouldn‚Äôt have picked marathon Sunday to finally hit up Frankel‚Äôs‚Äîit was packed! But what a great spot. I love their creative breakfast sandwich options, and the vibe was pure NYC energy. I got the pastrami, egg, and cheese on a‚Ä¶

Absolutely delicious! Hands down the best we had in NYC - very much through recommendation and we wholeheartedly recommend it on. Melt in your mouth meat and flavour running through. Lovely service too which I don‚Äôt always expect in highly rated, hype places anymore. Full of warmth and good humour - stand out stop for us on our UK to US trip.

I went here given the fact my last name is Frankel, and that I am part Jewish. I wanted to support a potential distant relatives business that they put our family name on. Not to mention, I love a good Jewish deli. The Frankel's #1 was excellent, and the Frankel's BLT(got it for my girlfriend) She said it was great. Going to go back for the Lox, Pastrami, and everything else going forward. I'll always support this place from now on, not only becuase I'm bias and a Frankel, but becuase it is genuinely very good, and the ingredients are high quality
Delicious
Great food and excellent service! Thank you guys for making our first experience pastrami a truly unforgettable one!
Best bagel in Brooklyn. Always friendly service.

We did an overnight from Toronto to eat sandwiches in NYC and this (pastrami egg and cheese) was my highlight. Service was great and it's a cool place to sit on the street and watch the world go by. I'm going to be thinking about this until the next time I have it again. Must do.
literally amazing!!!
Very clean interior and lovely staff. I ordered the bacon egg and cheese on an everything and it was very tasty and packed full!

Frankel‚Äôs hits the spot. The sandwiches here are next-level, fresh, flavourful, and super satisfying. I had the pastrami and egg bagel and it was unreal. Proper NYC deli vibes with a modern twist. Already looking forward to my next one!
The egg, greens and swiss sandwich was probably one of the best bagels I've ever had.
Pyszne bajgle i mi≈Ça obs≈Çuga :)
Always busy Always delicious Always closes early in the day. My go-to is the brisket sandwich when it's available the latkas are lovely and the hotdogs are great

I love Frankels. The pastrami is incredible, dare I say better than Katz'süòÖ... you can really taste the spices with Frankels!! The BECs and everything else is also amazing. Try it on Challah bread! Life changing! Also everyone there is so nice all the time!
Every time I visit NYC I stop at Frankel‚Äôs

Updated review:
I am SO glad I went back. I tried the heirloom tomato bagel and the salmon tartare bagel and both were 10/10!!

Original review:
I really wanted to love this place but my bagel sandwich was very disappointing. I got the pastrami egg & cheese on a sesame bagel, which was gorgeous but, unfortunately, completely lacking in flavor. I want to give them one more shot and try one of the more traditional bagel + lox sandwiches, which will hopefully live up to the hype!
Great bagel and cream cheese, my favorite coffee in this area. Super friendly and warm staff. Short wait and reasonably priced.

Everything here was amazing. From the vibes to cuts, Frankel‚Äôs Deli just made sense ü§åüèæ. This was the pastrami sandwich on brioche..babe???
Chef‚Äôs kiss üë©‚Äçüç≥üòò. Yummy, warm, and delectable!

+ the staff was so fun and kind. They made my time the best. Can‚Äôt wait to stop by again!!!
O e of the best Lox cream cheese bagels I've ever had.
Hot brisket sandwich there is no flavor and for $26 to much for a flavorless sandwich

Got the pastrami- egg challah, I kid you not, to die for. Worth the extra trip for this. Besides the pastrami being good? Lots of it in the sandwich as well. Tops many bagel places manhattan for sure

Bonus points:
Great babka!
Best pastrami I've ever had
No parking
Fantastic hot pastrami sandwich. Great staff and nice seating outside.
scrumptious

Make the trip here! It‚Äôs so worth it! Bagels are great no doubt but do not skip on the Babka !! I mean it‚Äôs going to really kiss your belly! Soft, chewy, buttery, fill with cinnamon kisses! They are super nice too! Grab a seat and look out the window! I ate so fast I forgot to take pictures.
Last good bagel place left in Williamsburg. Reasonably priced and great service, my new fav, wish I tried sooner

This bagel spot deserves all the hype. The lox on the "Classic" Nova Bagel is buttery and perfectly melts into the capers and red onions. The fillings are so generous that it‚Äôs sometimes hard to bite into the sandwich without the contents sliding out. And the sesame bagel itself is great -- crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside and the right amount of dense.
The real star of the show here though is the Pastami, Egg & Cheese on a bagel. Talk about indulgence. The pastrami is juicy, and tender and melds so nicely with the melty American cheese.

Pastrami ottimo veramente ma lo consiglio col formaggio e uova e senza monstarda ma il locale √® abbastanza piccolo e chiude presto inoltre i prezzi sono troppo alti‚Ä¶servizio gentilissimo da parte della ragazza alla cassa e non troppo veloce‚Ä¶
Nice quiet spot friendly people
The sliced Babka slaps! üëå‚Ä¶

I‚Äôve been a fan of hot dogs since I was a kid in the late 70s. I‚Äôve had a hot dog at various stadiums and arenas. I‚Äôve had hot dogs in various countries. I consider myself a hot dog connoisseur. Frankels is without a doubt one of the BEST dogs I‚Äôve had in my entire life. Perfect snap with delicious kraut. I see why this place is always busy.

Everyone is so nice and recommendations honest. Husband and I went for a breakfast date, shared pastrami egg/cheese and Brisket egg/cheese sandwich and babka slice. I understand why the pastrami is popular (savory and spiced right), brisket was a little sweet for my taste but they were both good! So perfect on a fresh soft brioche bun - chefs kiss
Very impressive.  As someone who has pretty much only gone to Katz this is up there.  Dare I say it, potentially even just as a good given less of a crowded store and friendly staff. Must try.

So,after seeing this deli on a foodie blog. Drove a hundred miles to try it.non typical Jewish deli, no knishes? The pastrami the best I had in years. Hand cut with a thick bark that was juicy top to bottom. Would drive again without a thought. Had leftover next morning with eggs,just as good, if not better. Worth the trip from near or far.

We placed a large pickup order from Frankel‚Äôs for our wedding's morning-after brunch, and it was perfect. Everything was ready on time and tasted amazing‚Äîbagels, lox, whitefish salad, chicken salad, cream cheese, the works. The pastrami smoked salmon is next-level. We ended up with fewer guests than expected (hello, wedding hangovers), so we froze about 50 leftover bagels and ate them for weeks‚Äîthey held up beautifully. Frankel‚Äôs was easy to work with, affordable for the amount of food, and a huge crowd-pleaser. Highly recommend for event catering or stocking up on freezer bagels.

Frankel‚Äôs came across my for you and I instantly started following them. Once I made it to NY, I made it a priority to check them out. Their pastrami egg & cheese is what caught my eye & I was not disappointed. Great spot. Definitely worth trying out when you‚Äôre in Brooklyn

I got the whitefish bagel, and it was delicious. However, I was really disappointed with how little whitefish spread it had ‚Äî I could barely taste it. Considering how expensive it was, I expected a much more generous portion. Tasty, but im not sure its worth the price.

$12 for bec. so expensive for what it is and the bagel sandwich was just ok- nothing special. my kid loves bec and he refused to eat it- probably because the egg texture was odd. He liked the bacon. The cinnamon raisin bagel tasted like a‚Ä¶
So good ü§§
Dry, hard bagel - inexcusable for $20 bagel sandwich. Everything else just ok. Good service
Amazing Pastrimi, Egg and Cheese!

I‚Äôve heard so much about this spot and yeah, never got around to it because they only open till 3 PM each day. Today I finally made it and it was well worth the weight.

Relatively small establishment however staff is huge on courtesy. I tried their famous hot pastrami on rye with mustard and boy I was simply blown away. Each bite was super tender, juicy and so flavorful. I was also impressed the rye bread did not fall apart easily.

Definitely a must visit and it‚Äôs definitely a top five pastrami sandwich in NYC.
Very warm, welcoming, and friendly atmosphere. Clean and bright. Food was fresh and beautifully presented.

I kept seeing the line out of the door for this place and I wanted to see what the hubbub was all about.  I. Still. Don't. Know. I got an everything bagel with tomato and scallion cream cheese. It was expensive and NOT good. This was like any blah bagel you'd get at whatever bodega. I was ready to be blown away, and I was wildly underwhelmed.  Despite being really hungry I even ended up throwing it away because it was such a letdown. Maybe something else is their specialty?  Bagels are not.

Service was good, spot is cut but the bagel did not hit. Can't recommend.

By the time I remembered to take a picture of my bagel sandwich I had already eaten almost all of it. This is how good this place is. Chill atmosphere, super friendly staff, delicious fresh food! Just had the smoked salmon on sesame bagel and would come right back for it. Perfect ratio of salmon to cream cheese to capers and onion. Nothing overpowering the salmon, just making it more delicious. Bagel was toasted just right and the sandwich was wrapped well and cut fully! Nothing bugs me more than fighting with partially cut wrapping paper and then fighting to tear it.
Loved it and coming back for more!

Came back a second time: same amazing experience just more people! This time took a photo! üòâ
Better than Kat's or any other pastrami you'll find in the City.  Kind personnel, no waiting line and cool neighborhood. Highly recommend!
Great service and cool retro feel, bagels were great but ever so slightly flat.
Extremely good. Perfected the cheese to meat to egg to bread ratio
Our breakfast sandwiches were amazing! Such friendly staff! Quick service. We will be back.

Great spot for delish, authentic bagels and the like!  I had the classic (Lox and all the fixings) and I was good till dinner!!  The staff were super nice and helpful.  I spilled my tea as I was sitting and they were quick to help me clean it up and promptly provided me a replacement!  Also... additional Kudos to the owner for not skimping on paper products!  The bagel comes wrapped in sturdy classic deli paper which is perfect for eating on the go!  Substantial napkins are plentiful and do the trick given the generous cream cheese servings! Frankel's was a great find on our weekend to Brooklyn!

Se vi piace il pastrami (e se non sapete cosa sia √® un buon motivo per andarci),questo √® il locale top.Il pastrami si trova ovunque a NY ma qui √® veramente ottimo! Non √® economico (come del resto tutta NY) ma ne vale veramente la pena. Anche se non √® nella zona "turistica" di NY, il sandwich che mangerete vale la pena del "viaggio" (la zona √® servita da una sola linea della metro) e non √® a Manhattan (confine Queens / Brooklyn). Attenzione che fa orario solo mattutino (dalle 8 alle 15),noi siamo stati fortunati ad arrivare alle 14.45 per puro caso (abbiamo fatto una variazione fortuita del programma,in origine avevamo pianificato di cenare l√≠, dando per scontato che fosse aperto).

Absolutely delicious! Every bagel has the perfect texture, made using a traditional recipe‚Äîand the fillings? Incredible. Thick layers of the freshest ingredients. I‚Äôm seriously obsessed. Total bagel heaven! ü•Ø‚ú®

Their heirloom tomatoes bagel sandwich is unreal ü§§ü§§ü§§ don‚Äôt know how they can turn even the skin of tomato to a buttery texture, but they can and they do! Love the flavouring oil they add to this sandwich, can‚Äôt get enough of it.. their salmon sandwich is also soooooo delicious, and the white fish is interesting
(Have done only delivery, would love to try their amazing dishes fresh in person)

Lives up to the hype, retro deli with great food. Got the classic pastrami egg and cheese on an everything. Quick, hot, and delicious. Enough seating for a quick bite, all counter stools along the window. One of their better deals is 1/2 dozen day old bagels for $6.
Sicuramente un ottimo Pastrami in un ambiente semplice e molto pulito. Forse non √® all‚Äôaltezza di altri luoghi storici per il pastrmi ma √® sicuramente un ottima alternativa

Frankel‚Äôs is a great, modern retro Jewish deli. The pastrami is outstanding: unctuous, tender, great spice rub and an ample portion. We loved the Reuben along with cole slaw and horseradish beets! The service is efficient and the place is charming. There are maybe 8 counter seats along the windows and lots of takeout delivery people arriving.
great sammich shop in greenpoint! the pastrami and tuna salad sammiches were both great. a bit expensive but they do load the sammiches with plenty of ingredients/meat

I visit Frankel's Deli almost every time when I'm in town. Frankel's never disappoints.

This time I got the "Frankel's #1 Bagel" and a bacon egg & cheese on a roll.

The bagel itself wasn't the best bagel I have had in New York, but still pretty solid. The toppings though were A1. The combination of the pastrami salmon, scallion cream cheese and the dill cucumber salad worked really well.

The bacon egg & cheese on a roll is just perfect, 10/10! It's my alltime favorite bacon egg& cheese sandwich. I had it couple of times already.
The roll is the fluffiest roll you can imagine and the consistencies are on point. Crunchy bacon and gooey egg/cheese.

Lucky for us we got a hotel right down the road from Frankel‚Äôs Deli. This was on my list for must visit deli while in Brooklyn. It didn‚Äôt disappoint. We got the Frankel‚Äôs #1 Bagel Pastrami salmon,scallion cream cheese & dill cucumber salad on an everything Bagel, toasted. Simple but absolutely delicious. The service was spot on. Couldn‚Äôt ask for a better start to our visit to NY.

Top tier open-faced bagels. Frankel‚Äôs is now one of my top three favorite bagel spots in NYC. I wish I lived closer to Greenpoint, but I‚Äôm willing to make the trek for these bagels.

ÔºäThe Tartare w. Dill CC on Onion Bagel
I don‚Äôt normally splurge on a lox bagel, but this one is worth every penny of it. Salmon tartare on bagel is a game changer and I‚Äôm still dreaming about it.

You can choose your own cream cheese for this bagel sandwich. I find dill cream cheese usually goes well with salmon and I highly recommend this combo.

ÔºäHeirloom Tomato on Sesame Bagel
Heirloom tomato really makes all the difference ‚Äî the sliced tomato is incredibly juicy and sweet. It comes with scallion cream cheese and herbs. Very fragrant and flavorful.

ÔºäAnita‚Äôs Hot Brisket on Griddled Challah
My bf gave his highest praise on this lunch sandwich. They really don‚Äôt skimp on the braised brisket ‚Äî the sandwich is so hefty and thick! Meat is juicy and you can drizzle hot sauce for an extra kick of heat. The challah is well toasted and buttery.

The pastrami, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich was tasty and filling. The place is has a simple interior with few seats and no restroom. It might be best to order out unless you're having a quick meal. I also like the fact that it's next to the G train and bus stops.

It's very tasty but I consider it overpriced (especially for Brooklyn and a place that mainly offers stuff "to go", since there's only a couple seats available). Katz's is more expensive but the experience is different (and it's in Manhattan)

Best place to eat a scrumptious breakfast sandwich and people watch on a weekend morning.

Perfectly cooked Egg and cheese!
Pastrami is salty and flavorful.
They have other treats too like the babka.

It does get pretty busy, so I would come early as possible

This is actually the best bagel place in Williamsburg/Greenpoint. Fresh ingredients, generous sizes, kind staff and decent prices. This is going to be my new bagel spot! Everyone else needs to step up their game!!!

Update: I went back and they remembered me which was nice. Still the best bagel place. The pastrami bagel was üî•üî•üî•üî•

Frankel‚Äôs Fifty Dollar Flop for Two‚Ñ¢Ô∏è

Hot pastrami and a classic salmon nova lox bagel sandwich‚Ä¶ both severely devoid of flavor. The design and customer experience inside the store was delicious I just wish the food matched. Love the tote bag and all of the merch available here.

Regrettably we had to go home to season and spice up the food so it had some semblance of flavor. Not writing them off completely, but the price tag and reviews made me expect more from this prime location.

Really good bagel. The place is quite small but you have some chairs in order to eat there. You can always order to go. The place is not in manhattan so you will need to travel 30‚Äô on subway in order to reach the place. The service was really good. The only thing to mentioned is that you need to go early because if not some of the bagels are not going to be available. Great food quality.
Wait about 20 min on a stmaturday morning. WORTH IT. pastrami  and smoked salmon is incredible. We got the pastrami, egg, & cheese and the frankels #1. WOW DAMN. Also damn good iced coffee.

Best bagel sandwich spot in the neighborhood. The taylor ham egg and cheese has a special goey place in my heart whenever i am struggle bussing on a saturday or sunday morning.

Its always busy because they are awesome so if you cant wait order ahead while you walk through the park, and dont go to late because they still sell out of everything sometimes.

First up on the list we had this Pastrami, Egg, and Cheese on a Challah Roll, absolutely loved it, it was soft, the meat was tender, and the eggs were so fluffy. The Frankel‚Äôs #1 Bagel has pastrami salmon, and the classic toppings, I would prefer less cucumber next time as I thought it took away from the salmon, but still a decent bagel. Lastly, the Pastrami Reuben was toasted to perfection, melty Swiss cheese, and and the pastrami once again was incredibly tender, warm, and juicy.
Cute little corner spot with amazing food!! My husband and I split the pastrami and walked away full and satisfied.
Pretty fire pastrami! Not too salty and good flavors. The pastrami egg and cheese on challah fell apart a bit while eating but that‚Äôs fine. Pickles were salty briny and crunchy.

My go to sandwich place in the neighborhood. I love the pastrami sandwich (if I‚Äôm feeling hungry), the roast turkey (if I‚Äôm feeling healthy), and the frankel‚Äôs #1 bagel. The coleslaw here is great too. Pro tip: order online to avoid waiting in line!

Mmmmmm . I have a thing for bagel sandwiches in nyc , and this establishment is not bad .
There‚Äôs always a line waiting for these bad boys and my husband couldn‚Äôt pass up another try at a bagel shop so here we are .

The prices are pretty steep , which usually bagel shops aren‚Äôt .

But the we got the pastrami (I think) and I can see why they had a high price tag .
The meat was Katz delicatessen grade , seasoned well ,succulent and juicy .

Perhaps if I pass by the area, I‚Äôd come again . But I wouldn‚Äôt come all the way here just for a sandwich, esp given the price .

But overall tasty and worth a try ! And the cheese/meat pull ü§™

Wow one of the best bagel spots in town. Soft warm bagels with the perfect amount of ingredients inside.
The marinated dill cucumbers were so refreshing.
